meanings.sent1: After the race, he was outdriven by his opponent.
meanings.sent2: She outdriven all her competitors in the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outdriven the hare in the slow and steady race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outdriven any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The wind outdriven the sailboat across the vast ocean.

meanings.sent1: The new car outdriven all the others on the road.
meanings.sent2: He outdriven his previous record by a mile.
meanings.sent3: The little engine that could outdriven the big locomotive.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for success outdriven any doubts in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The champion outdriven all expectations with his performance.

meanings.sent1: The scarecrow outdriven the crows from the cornfield.
meanings.sent2: The bright light outdriven the darkness from the room.
meanings.sent3: The loud noise outdriven the silence in the library.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter outdriven the gloom in the room.
meanings.sent5: The strong scent of flowers outdriven the smell of smoke.
